Description of incident: "On April 19, 2016, I detected suspicious activity on a work computer.  I immediately took the computer off-line and contacted our IT consultant.  The consultant has confirmed unusual activity and changed potentially impacted passwords.  Further, on April 21, 2016, after a thorough analysis of the computer, the consultant removed malware found on the impacted computer's hard drive, and confirmd all firewalls and security protections were properly functioning."The information compromised included names, gender, dates of birth, telephone numbers, addresses, Social Security numbers, all employment (W-2) information, direct deposit bank account information. More Information: http://oag.ca.gov/ecrime/databreach/reports/sb24-61797
